meanings.definition: Insert a catheter into (a body part)
meanings.sent1: The nurse will catheterize the patient's bladder to drain urine.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often catheterize patients before surgery to monitor fluid levels.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy intern tried to catheterize the wrong patient, causing a mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to catheterize her heart, reaching deep within her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The image of the doctor carefully catheterizing the vein stayed with him for days.

meanings.sent1: The experienced nurse will catheterize the patient quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent2: It is important for medical students to learn how to catheterize patients correctly.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that he could catheterize a patient blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to catheterize the patient's fears, calming them instantly.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to catheterize the patient in record time.
